definition:
A topological space $X$ is said to be [*extremally disconnected*]{} if
every open set in $X$ has an open closure.

It can be shown that $X$ is extremally disconnected iff any two disjoint
open sets in $X$ have disjoint closures. Every extremally disconnected
space is totally disconnected.

#### Notes

Some authors like [@willard] and [@kelley] use the above definition as
is, while others (e.g. [@steen; @bourbaki]) require that an extremally
disconnected space should (in addition to the above condition) also be a
Hausdorff space.
